    • Method Detail

      • syncMediaFiles

        public SyncReply syncMediaFiles(java.lang.String mediaMask)
        Convenience method for syncMediaFiles(null, mediaMask, 0). This creates a new Sync Session each time it is called. Typically after calling this, you would either call syncMediaFiles(syncId, page) or destroySession(syncId).
        Parameters:
        mediaMask -
        Returns:

      • syncMediaFiles

        public SyncReply syncMediaFiles(java.lang.String syncId,
                                int page)
        Continues a sync session, requesting the next page for the given sync session id
        Parameters:
        syncId -
        page -
        Returns:

      • syncMediaFiles

        public SyncReply syncMediaFiles(java.lang.String syncId,
                                java.lang.String mediaMask,
                                int page)
        Begins/Continues a Sync Session whereby a SyncReply is returned containing the session id the first page of sync data. This sync is a "quick" sync, in that only a minimal amount of data is returned. Subsequent calls will pass a syncId and a page until all data is synced. Once the data is synced, destroySession(syncId) should be called to free up memory.
        Parameters:
        syncId -
        mediaMask -
        page -
        Returns:

      • destroySession

        public boolean destroySession(java.lang.String id)
